isis.stitle: HENDRICKSON SUSPENSION SYSTEMS - CLEAN AND INSPECT - LOAD CUSHION SUSPENSIONS - RS SERIES

step1.para: Inspect each frame bracket for cracks or other damage in the vertical mounting flange.
Remove the bracket from the frame to inspect for cracks or other damage in the horizontal mounting flange next to the vertical drive pin areas. Replace a bracket that has any cracks ( Figure 31).
To check for complete flange fracture, lift the chassis by the frame and look for separation of the vertical drive pin from the bracket flange. Replace any broken frame brackets.

warning.para: Do not operate a vehicle with cracked or broken frame brackets. This can lead to separation of components, loss of vehicle control, and possible property damage and personal injury.

svcsubproc.title: Load Cushions
svcsubproc.para: Inspect cushions for proper shape, proper height and proper position. Be sure there are no cuts, swelling or dirt accumulation. Replace load cushions that are damaged.

note.para: Normal free height of a load cushion is 3-15/16 inches (100 mm). A permanent set of not more than 1/4 inch (6 mm) is acceptable.
Replace a load cushion with free height under 3-11/16 inches (94 mm).
If cushions are cut by the retaining lips of the saddles or frame brackets, the cushions may not be the right type for the vehicle application.
Dump and transit mix environments can cause a buildup of dirt and other material under the cushions, causing them to escape the saddle retainer lips, and to twist out of position.

step1.para: Inspect the lower side of these bushings for torn or shredded rubber. Remove the bushing retainer caps to facilitate the inspection ( Figure 32).
Be certain that the concave washers are installed with the lips pointing downward. Press the bushings out of the saddles from the top.
If the outer sleeve is "frozen" to the saddle wall, press the inner sleeve and rubber out of the bushing, then work the outer sleeve out of the saddle.
Clean the bushing cavities with solvent. Remove nicks with an emery cloth.
Hand press new bushings into place.
Install the bushing caps and locknuts. Tighten to the values found in the TORQUE CHART.

caution.para: Aluminum saddles are heat-treated. Do not cut them with a torch, or use excessive heat during repair procedures.

svcsubproc.title: Saddle Cap Fasteners
svcsubproc.para: Tighten the saddle cap locknuts to the values found in the TORQUE CHART, to prevent wear of the beam center bushings into the legs of the saddles.
